design.name: Colony Ship
design.description:
The colony ship is what you'll need to colonize remote planets. They'll carry 100 of your colony's population to a brave new world.

Colony ships are single-use. The ship is destroyed once a planet is colonized.

upgrade.name: Cryogenic Chamber
upgrade.description: The cryogenic chamber means colonists are put to sleep during the voyage to the next planet. This allows for a larger number of colonists to be deployed, increasing the number of initial colonists from 100 to 400.

design.name: Scout
design.description: Scouts are small, fast ships with no attack capability (and not much in the way of defensive capabilities, either). What they are good at, though, is getting in and out of enemy starsystems and reporting back what they found.

upgrade.name: Cloak
upgrade.description: Adding a cloaking device to a scout makes it invisible to enemy radar. Additionally, if you set the scout's stance to "Neutral" or "Passive", it will remain undetected around enemy stars.

design.name: Fighter
design.description: Your basic fighter has average speed, low-grade weapons and low-grade shields. They make up for a general lack of firepower by being incredibly cheap to produce and fuel-efficient, allowing you to overwhealm your enemy with numbers.

upgrade.name: Warp Boost
upgrade.description: Boost will halve the remaining travel-time for an in-flight fleet of fighters.

design.name: Troop Carrier
design.description: The Troop Carrier carries ground troops which you can deploy to capture an enemy colony.

design.name: Wormhole Generator
design.description: The Wormhole Generator will - quite literally - generate a wormhole. Once the ship is built, select a location on the starfield to deploy, and the ship will generate a wormhole which you can then use to instantly transport ships throughout your empire.
